value.title: New stroke rehabilitation pattern based on brain-computer interface and robot technology
value.excerpt: Strokes, which occur when the blood supply to part of our brain is interrupted or reduced, are the leading cause of death and disability in the adult population.

value.title: Facebook teaches AI-powered robot to adapt while walking
value.excerpt: The four-legged robot resembles a dog walking over sand, rocks and other difficult surfaces. As it moves forward, the black robot adjusts its stride and adapts without falling.  Teaming up with Carnegie Mellon University's School of Computer Science and the University of California,

value.title: CORRECTING and REPLACING Artificial Intelligence Leader DataRobot to Host Morgantown Job Fair Tuesday, 7/13
value.excerpt: DataRobot, the leader in Artificial Intelligence, will host a public job fair from 3-7 p.m. at Morgantown’s Erickson Alumni Center on Tuesday, July 13th. In June, DataRobot announced the opening of a new office at Vantage Ventures Morgantown headquarters.

value.title: Buzz Off, Bees. Pollination Robots Are Here.
value.excerpt: Now, advances in artificial intelligence are helping some startups develop another way to pollinate plants: robots. Across the globe, startups are testing robots to pollinate everything from blueberries to almonds. And in Australia, one company is so ...

value.title: Robots Can Make Music, but Can They Sing?
value.excerpt: At an international competition called the A.I. Song Contest, tracks exploring the technology as a tool for music making revealed the potential — and the limitations.

value.title: The Pizza Delivery Guy Will Be a Robot at Many Campuses This Fall
value.excerpt: Russia’s Yandex will build the service’s rovers, as delivery companies turn to automation to cut costs in an industry boosted by the pandemic.

value.title: Abundant Robotics shuts down fruit harvesting business
value.excerpt: Abundant Robotics, which was developing a robot to pick apples, closed its business after spinning out of SRI International in 2016.

value.title: Sometimes interacting with robots is easier than with humans
value.excerpt: A new study shows higher performance in idea generation when humans believe they're interacting with a bot. Is working with robots in our future?

value.title: What's a robot manicure really like? Quick, cheap, and guilt-inducing.
value.excerpt: A robot gave me a manicure last week. Let me stop you before you envision a bipedal humanoid carefully dipping a brush into a bottle and lacquering my nails. Instead, the experience felt more like inserting my hand into a 3D printer.

value.title: AI-Driven Robots Are Here For Good
value.excerpt: AI, algorithms and technological applications are accelerating into new realms. With the proper implementation of ethics, diversity, and inclusive design - humans stand to benefit significantly.

value.title: Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare: Intel’s AI tool screens patients for vision loss
value.excerpt: Sankara Eye Foundation and Leben Care are deploying a cloud-based AI solution Netra.AI, powered by Intel technology, to identify retinal conditions in a short span of time with the accuracy level of h

value.title: The lessons we learn from self-driving will drive our robotics future
value.excerpt: Robotics is entering an exponential growth phase. There are increasingly new and diverse applications for robots, both the inspiring and the mundane. Just within the context of the COVID-19 pandemic response,

value.title: Lidar is the gold standard of robot vacuum navigation, but it’s not perfect
value.excerpt: Today's robot vacuums offer intelligent navigation courtesy of lidar tech. But despite being the gold standard of robot vacuum navigation, it's not perfect.

value.title: A Robot That Finds Your Lost Stuff and More AI-Enabled Gadgets to Come
value.excerpt: Researchers are working on a wave of sophisticated devices for the home, from toilets that screen for viruses to a ‘Roomba on steroids’ that might detect your TV remote in the couch.

value.title: Zebra (ZBRA) to Buy Fetch Robotics, Enhance Product Offerings
value.excerpt: Zebra Technologies Corporation ZBRA recently announced its intention to buy Fetch Robotics, Inc., a leading developer of autonomous mobile robots (AMRs) for $290 million. It’s worth noting that Zebra already owns 5% of Fetch Robotics and the latest announcement is related to the acquisition of the remaining 95% of the company.

value.title: ‘Are you thirsty?’ This AI-enabled robot can bring beer to holiday parties
value.excerpt: Heineken says its autonomous robot can hold up to 12 cans of beer, will follow you down the sidewalk and has a friendly AI personality.

value.title: Amazon plans to build delivery robot tech in Finland
value.excerpt: Amazon announced Thursday that it plans to develop new technology for its autonomous delivery vehicles in Helsinki, Finland.

value.title: After an $8.4M raise, strawberry-picking robotics startup Traptic begins commercial deployment
value.excerpt: We first covered Traptic back in 2019, when it appeared as a Battlefield finalist on stage at Disrupt SF. Today, the South Bay robotics startup is announcing some major progress. For starters, it began commercial deployment of its strawberry-picking mobile robot early this month.

value.title: Accel Robotics Claims Successful Deployment In San Diego
value.excerpt: San Diego-based Accel Robotics, which develops automated checkout systems designed for retail stores, claims it is seeing growth and success at its first rollout of "Valet Market", an automated store its has deployed ata a luxury,

value.title: Zebra Technologies to Acquire Fetch Robotics
value.excerpt: Zebra Technologies (NASDAQ: ZBRA), an innovator at the front line of business with solutions and partners that deliver a performance edge, today announced it intends to acquire Fetch Robotics, a pioneer in on-demand automation.

value.title: Food Supply Chain: Tyson Foods Invests in AI Robotics
value.excerpt: Tyson Foods - among others - invests in Soft Robotics Series B extension, expanding the use of AI, robotics and automation in the food supply chain

value.title: Nice publishes ethical framework for applying AI to customer service
value.excerpt: Robotic process automation firm Nice published an ethical framework for applying AI and RPA to customer support functions.

value.title: Cheers to the Heineken B.O.T. Self-Driving Beer Delivery Robot
value.excerpt: You could train your dog to grab one for you, which would take effort, time, and commitment. Or you could turn to Heineken's new B.O.T., which is, yep, a beer-carrying robot that brings the beers to you.

value.title: This AI Just Evolved From Companion Robot To Home-Based Physician Helper
value.excerpt: The Israeli startup has developed the AI-based, award-winning proactive social robot ElliQ which has spent over 30,000 days in older adults’ homes over the past two years. Now ElliQ will help increase patient engagement while offering primary care providers continuous actionable data and insights for early detection and intervention.

value.title: Japan’s SoftBank says Pepper robot remains ‘alive’ and well
value.excerpt: Japanese technology company SoftBank denies it’s pulling the plug on its friendly, talking, bubble-headed Pepper robot. “There is absolutely no change to our Pepper business,”

value.title: Techman Robot to Provide Free AI Courses in Southeast Asia
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence, AI is undoubtedly the key technology here. That is why the SEA (Southeast Asia) Taiwan AI College is turning the AI manufacturing experiences from leading ICT companies, Techman Robot,

value.title: Machine learning startup DataRobot reportedly raises $250M on $6B valuation
value.excerpt: Machine learning automation startup DataRobot Inc. has raised $250 million in new funding, according to Axios on a valuation of around $6 billion. Altimeter Capital Management and Tiger Global are said to have led the Series G round.

value.title: Tyson Co-Leads $10M Investment Round for AI-Powered Robotics Startup
value.excerpt: Tyson's venture capital arm helped raise the funds for food robotics firm Soft Robotics, which makes soft-grasping robots with the hand-eye coordination of humans.
